intro: Freycinetia ferox, commonly known as the New Caledonian screw pine, is a unique species native to the island of New Caledonia. It is a member of the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by fleshy, red or orange berries. Freycinetia ferox is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found growing in coastal areas or on limestone substrates. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for local wildlife.
